s.text: In their love lives, each actress served as Miracle-Gro to an especially prized kind of male creativity.
Which leads us to another intriguing similarity between Leaving a Doll's House and What Falls Away : Both have met with awkward, squeamish reviews.
They want women to stop harping about men and start taking care of their own lives.
Not that any of this justifies the truly rotten choices both Bloom and Farrow have made.
Not that any of this justifies the truly rotten choices both Bloom and Farrow have made.
Not that any of this justifies the truly rotten choices both Bloom and Farrow have made.

Each courtship begins with the great man sending charming but oddly formal notes to his beloved or having his secretary call to determine the time, place, and sometimes the precise length of their meeting.
Her sin: She was forgetting that he had pointed out Buckley's house to her the year before.
Her sin: She was forgetting that he had pointed out Buckley's house to her the year before.
To be fair, Roth emerges as the tamer monster.
To be fair, Roth emerges as the tamer monster.
Roth resents having to go to the opera, having to make arrangements for Bloom's mother's funeral, and (less unreasonably) having to deal with Bloom's nervousness in the face of illness.
But it is curious that these actresses should be attacked instead of encouraged in their efforts to change.
(Or maybe it isn't so curious: Philip Weiss tellingly led his attack on Farrow in the New York Observer last week with a little temper tantrum at his mom.)
But it is curious that these actresses should be attacked instead of encouraged in their efforts to change.

But it is curious that these actresses should be attacked instead of encouraged in their efforts to change.
The days when we felt sorry for the famous are over--nowadays, we dislike stars who plead confusion, insecurity, and no common sense.
A few months before she reviewed Bloom's book, Merkin wrote a long personal essay for The New Yorker about how much she likes to be spanked.
Bloom started appearing on stage at 15.
